bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding certain motor vehicle dealer license plates and permits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding certain motor vehicle dealer license plates and permits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-9-59 be amended to read as follows: 32-9-59. Any new or used vehicle owned by a licensed vehicle dealer, bearing a dealer's 88 license plate issued pursuant to the provisions of §§ 32-6B-22.1 and 32-6B-22.2 may operate such vehicle for the licensed dealership as a motor carrier or any prospective buyer may operate such vehicle as a motor carrier for demonstration purposes for a period of three days, in accordance with the provisions of § 32-6B-25 under the following conditions: (1) The motor vehicle shall comply with all provisions of this chapter pertaining to overweight operation; (2) The maximum actual gross weight of the vehicle and load does not exceed the licensed gross weight may not exceed twenty-six thousand pounds; and (3) The gross weight tonnage fees shall be paid pursuant to § 32-9-15 with the tonnage sticker affixed to the 88 plate prior to operation as a motor carrier. If a used or new vehicle dealer permits the use by a prospective buyer, pursuant to this section, a vehicle bearing the dealer's 88 license plate, the dealer shall maintain a log detailing the use. The log shall include the name and address of the prospective buyer, the dates of use, and the description of the vehicle including the vehicle identification number, make, and model. This log shall be available for inspection, during normal business hours, by any law enforcement officer or dealer inspector appointed by the department. Any violation of this section is a class 2 Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 32-6B-31 be repealed. 32-6B-31. The department shall issue to dealers licensed under this chapter, a master demonstration commercial license permit in lieu of commercial fees for the unusual use of the highways, as provided for in chapter 32-9. A permit shall be furnished upon application required by the department and the payment of a fee of fifty dollars. All such fees shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund. The permit shall expire on the thirtieth day of June each year. The department may withdraw a master demonstration commercial license permit for any violation of the provisions of this chapter. Section 3. That § 32-6B-32 be repealed. 32-6B-32. Any vehicle which is otherwise required to pay commercial license fees for the unusual use of the highways may be operated for the purpose of demonstration and potential sale on occasional demonstration trips over the highways of this state if the driver is in possession of an individual trip permit plainly describing the vehicle, specifying the route to be traveled from starting point to destination, approximate time of departure, approximate time of arrival at destination, the merchandise being transported, the name of the company or individual for whom the demonstration is being made, and the name of the holder of the master permit. Section 4. That § 32-6B-33 be repealed. 32-6B-33. The Department of Revenue shall provide for the publication, sale, and delivery of books containing single trip permits authorized by § 32-6B-32. The department, pursuant to chapter 1-26, may promulgate rules to provide for the issuance of such permits and to set the fee for those permits.
